alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 07 at 3:55AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Elevated Fire Weather Danger Predicted Today... A significantly drier airmass and gusty winds will move into the region this afternoon and these conditions will combine with dead and dry fuels such as grass, leaves, and twigs to create the potential for uncontrolled fire spread across south-central New Hampshire and portions of southwestern Maine today. This afternoon, relative humidity values will decrease to low levels between 25 to 35%. At the same time, west to northwest winds between 15 to 20 mph with frequent gusts of up to 35 mph will continue to dry fuels and increase fire spread potential. Wind gusts are expected to diminish some later this evening with increasing relative humidity values. Extra caution should be taken to prevent wildfires. Always consult with fire officials before engaging in any open burning activities and comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Never leave an open fire unattended and always extinguish campfires completely before leaving.
